summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting the final disposition of evidence related to OIG Case Number 2019-010614. The evidence, which includes logs, personnel files, and electronic items from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, was transferred from the OIG to Special Investigation Agents of the Bureau of Prisons on December 19, 2024. The document lists numerous items of evidence, many related to the detention and monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein in July and August 2019.

connections.description: Both signed the evidence disposition documents, indicating a formal transfer of custody from OIG (Daniel) to BOP (Paritsky).
Both are Special Investigation Agents (SIAs) with the Federal Bureau of Prisons who received the transferred evidence.
Both are BOP staff whose personnel files were seized as evidence in the same investigation.

events.title: Evidence Disposition Transfer
events.description: Special Agents from the DOJ OIG transferred custody of evidence related to Case 2019-010614 to Special Investigation Agents of the BOP at the Metropolitan Detention Center Brooklyn.

events.title: Epstein Detention Logs
events.description: Multiple inmate count slips from the Metropolitan Correctional Center for various times (12:00 a.m., 3:00 a.m., 5:00 a.m., 10:00 a.m.) were collected as evidence.

events.title: Epstein Observation Log Period
events.description: An 'Epstein Observation Log' covering this date range was collected as evidence (Log 17, Item 1).

events.title: Earlier Epstein Observation Log Period
events.description: An 'Epstein Observation Log' covering this earlier date range was collected as evidence (Log 17, Item 2).

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center Brooklyn, New York
keyFacts: The document is a formal record of the DOJ OIG transferring evidence custody to the BOP for Case 2019-010614, which is related to Jeffrey Epstein's detention.
The evidence includes specific logs from Epstein's time in custody, such as 'Epstein Observation Logs' from July 2019 and inmate count slips from August 10, 2019.
Personnel files for four BOP staff members (Michael Thomas, Tova Noel, Robert Adams, Glenda Anderson-Layne) were part of the evidence transferred.
Electronic evidence includes 18 hard drives from the MCC's NICE VISION camera system and computer equipment, indicating a review of surveillance footage.
The evidence list includes a 'CPAP Machine' and its attachments, which is notable given the circumstances of Epstein's death.
